result.execSummary:
The defendant Wayne A Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event of non-payment of outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.  Attorney Fees To Be Determined.

Defendant Wayne A Johnson in court with attorney Stephen Donald Willett.  John Michael O'Boyle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
PLQ filed.   State moves to amend to 2 misdemeanor counts of  961.573(1). (possession of drug para) Court grants the amendment and so orders.   Defendant pleads guilty to both amended counts; 
 The Court finds  plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and finds the defendant guilty.  Factual basis found.  
Argument by State

 Court orders:
$50 plus costs
 on each count.

May have a payment plan.

Defendant Wayne A Johnson in court with attorney Stephen Donald Willett.  Defendant Wayne A Johnson in custody.  Russell Edward Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. THIS COVERS 15CF186, 15CF187 AND 15CF241. Defendant's request to modify bond cash bond in 15CF241. Court denies Defendant's motion to modify bond.

Defendant Wayne A Johnson in court with attorney Stephen Donald Willett.  Defendant Wayne A Johnson in custody.  Russell Edward Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant's Motion to Suppress evidence. 2:27: Detective Jason Olson with the Barron County Sheriff's Dept. called, sworn and direct by State. 2:34: Cross by Defense. State makes argument. Defense makes argument. Court does find there was a search warrant for a cell phone at Defendant's residence. Court finds that the officer's search did not find the cell phone but that a zipper door was found, and that it was lawful for the officers to search that room for the cell phone. Defense to submit brief by October 1, 2015. State to reply by October 15, 2015. Court will then issue written decision.
